content.raw:
At this point, it seems the issue is that we're trying to mix the old Windows CI (used by Gazebo and SDFormat) with the new Windows CI (used by the ignition projects).

This is related the [unfinished SDFormat PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/401/) for getting Windows support back. I think the only notable barrier is that someone needs to take the time to precompile and upload the Windows dependencies, using Visual Studio 2017. Getting the boost dependency built is probably the biggest chore.

At this point, it seems the issue is that we're trying to mix the old Windows CI (used by Gazebo and SDFormat) with the new Windows CI (used by the ignition projects).

This is related the unfinished SDFormat PR for getting Windows support back. I think the only notable barrier is that someone needs to take the time to precompile and upload the Windows dependencies, using Visual Studio 2017. Getting the boost dependency built is probably the biggest chore.
